intro: Licania fritschii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, star-shaped fruits similar to those of the genus Carambola. Licania fritschii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
